conclusion: Analyze motion of missile in two phases: vertical ascent and curvilinear trajectory.
Missile launched vertically from ground, reaches 20000m, ascends to 5000m with uniform upward acceleration, then follows curved trajectory to intercept aircraft.
Missile accelerates uniformly upward from rest with acceleration of 100 m/s^2.
Using equation v^2 = u^2 + 2as, find final velocity v = 1000 m/s.
Horizontal velocity remains constant during ascent, it is 0.
Missile follows curved trajectory with constant horizontal acceleration ax.
Vertical component of velocity at end of ascent is 1000 m/s.
Find horizontal acceleration ax using equation ax = v_x^2 / (2s) = 100 m/s^2.
Horizontal velocity at time of impact is 1732.05 m/s.
